meanings.definition: A stone or concrete edging along the side of a street or sidewalk.
meanings.sent1: The kerbstones along the sidewalk prevent cars from driving onto the pavement.
meanings.sent2: I tripped over the kerbstones while walking along the street.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel balanced on the kerbstones, pretending to be a tightrope walker.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as solid as the kerbstones lining the road.
meanings.sent5: The kerbstones stood like guardians, protecting the pedestrians from the traffic.

meanings.definition: To line or pave with kerbstones.
meanings.sent1: The workers will kerbstone the new road to enhance its durability.
meanings.sent2: They kerbstoned the garden path to give it a neat appearance.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully kerbstoned the imaginary road with small pebbles.
meanings.sent4: She kerbstones her conversations with humor to keep them engaging.
meanings.sent5: The artist kerbstoned the canvas with bold strokes, creating a striking contrast.
